N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 676.9 - Staffing

State Regulations
(a) A description
of and rationale for the diagnostic and research clinic's staffing pattern
shall be included in the clinic's policies and procedures manual. Any changes
in the staffing pattern, job descriptions, and/or minimal qualifications of the
staff shall be reviewed and approved by OPWDD. (b) The diagnostic and research clinic shall
have appropriately qualified medical, clinical laboratory, professional, and
administrative staff on duty in sufficient numbers to carry out the clinic's
policies, responsibilities and services, and to maintain the premises in a safe
and sanitary condition. A staff of sufficient size shall be employed so that
the clinic does not have to depend on individuals or volunteers to provide
services. However, interns and students assigned for formal work experience are
encouraged to participate in the clinic's programs, but shall no be used as
substitutes for staff. (c) The
diagnostic and research clinic shall have a director of its clinical laboratory
certified by the New York State Department of Health (see paragraph [2] of this
subdivision), who may also serve as the clinical director of the diagnostic and
research clinic. (1)

The certified director
of the clinical laboratory shall be responsible for administration of the
technical and scientific operation of the clinical laboratory and/or blood
bank, including supervision of procedures, reporting of results, and ensuring
the validity of the results. (2)

The clinical laboratory director shall be certified under the State Sanitary

Code as contained in 10 NYCRR Part
19. Notes
